extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1½ C whole milk(+ ¼ C extra if desired)

recipes.title: Honey Pumpkin Pudding
recipes.instructions: In a saucepan combine the pumpkin puree with the honey over medium low heat and whisk until the honey has melted enough and the two are completely combined.Make sure the mixture is not too hot and add in the eggs. Mix the cornstarch with a small amount of milk until there are no lumps then add the cornstarch mixture along with the spice, the rest of the milk and a pinch of salt to the pot.Whisk together and cook over medium heat just until thickened and just starting to boil. When thick, remove from the heat and pour the pudding into individual ramekins. Pudding will thicken more as it cools.Let cool slightly before covering with plastic wrap and refrigerating until ready to serve.To serve top with a sprinkle more pumpkin pie spice if desired and a dollop of sweetened whipped cream.

steps.step: In a saucepan combine the pumpkin puree with the honey over medium low heat and whisk until the honey has melted enough and the two are completely combined.Make sure the mixture is not too hot and add in the eggs.
Mix the cornstarch with a small amount of milk until there are no lumps then add the cornstarch mixture along with the spice, the rest of the milk and a pinch of salt to the pot.

Whisk together and cook over medium heat just until thickened and just starting to boil. When thick, remove from the heat and pour the pudding into individual ramekins. Pudding will thicken more as it cools.
Let cool slightly before covering with plastic wrap and refrigerating until ready to serve.To serve top with a sprinkle more pumpkin pie spice if desired and a dollop of sweetened whipped cream.
